node.statement: DERIVATIVE COMPUTATIONS: Since r'(x) = n * prod_{k=1}^{n-1}(x - gamma_k), differentiating gives r''(x) = n * d/dx[prod_{k=1}^{n-1}(x - gamma_k)] = n * sum_{k=1}^{n-1} prod_{l=1, l!=k}^{n-1}(x - gamma_l). This is the standard formula for the derivative of a product. Evaluating at a root lambda_i of r: r'(lambda_i) = n * prod_{k=1}^{n-1}(lambda_i - gamma_k) which is nonzero by the interlacing property (Step 1.4.2). And r''(lambda_i) = n * sum_{k=1}^{n-1} prod_{l!=k}(lambda_i - gamma_l).
